au.edu.federation.caliko.visualisation

Class ShaderProgram

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.federation.caliko.visualisation.ShaderProgram

  • public class ShaderProgram
extends Object
    A class to represent an OpenGL shader program.

    This class is adapted (with thanks!) from: http://schabby.de/opengl-shader-example/

    Version:
    0.6 - 21/12/2014
    Author:
    Al Lansley

      • ShaderProgram

        Constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • initFromFiles

        public void initFromFiles(String vertexShaderFilename,
                          String fragmentShaderFilename)
        Load and compile vertex and fragment shaders from file, then link them to this shader program and validate its status.

        If the loading, compilation, linkage or validation processes fail then a RuntimeException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        vertexShaderFilename - The filename to load the vertex shader from.
        fragmentShaderFilename - The filename to load the fragment shader from.

      • initFromStrings

        public void initFromStrings(String vertexShaderSource,
                            String fragmentShaderSource)
        Compile vertex and fragment shaders from Strings, then link them to this shader program and validate its status.

        If the compilation, linkage or validation processes fail then a RuntimeException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        vertexShaderSource - The string containing the vertex shader GLSL source code.
        fragmentShaderSource - The string containing the fragment shader GLSL source code.

      • addAttribute

        public int addAttribute(String attributeName)
        Add an attribute to the shader program and return the bound location.

        If the attribute has already been added to this shader program then its location is returned.

        If the named attribute is not an active attribute in the specified program, of it the attribute starts with the reserved prefix "gl_" then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        attributeName - The name of the attribute to add to this shader program
        Returns:
        The bound location of the new attribute.
        See Also:
        glGetAttribLocation

      • addUniform

        public int addUniform(String uniformName)
        Add a uniform to the shader program and return the bound location.

        If the uniform has already been added to this shader program then its location is returned.

        If the name does not correspond to an active uniform variable in the program or starts with the reserved prefix "gl_", or if the name is associated with an atomic counter or a named uniform block then a IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        uniformName - The name of the attribute to add to this shader program
        Returns:
        The bound location of the new uniform.
        See Also:
        glGetUniformLocation

      • attribute

        public int attribute(String attributeName)
        Return the location of the named attribute.

        If the named attribute does not exist in the attribute map then a RuntimeException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        attributeName - The name of the attribute for which we want to return the attribute Id.
        Returns:
        The bound location of the attribute.

      • uniform

        public int uniform(String uniformName)
        Return the location of the named uniform.

        If the named uniform does not exist in the uniform map then a RuntimeException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        uniformName - The name of the uniform for which we want to return the uniform Id.
        Returns:
        The bound location of the uniform.

      • getProgramId

        public int getProgramId()
        Get the shader program id.
        Returns:
        The program id.

      • use

        public void use()
        Set this ShaderProgram to be the one in use.

        If the shader program is not initialised before attempting to be used then a RuntimeException is thrown.

      • disable

        public void disable()
